key.name: propagate
key.description: Indicates whether events that reach this logger should be propogated toward the root of the logger hierarchy. If true (the default), events will be passed to the logger's parent after being handled. If false, events will be handled and the parent will not be informed. There is not a way to control propogation by the severity of the event.

key.name: name
key.description: The dotted name of the logger. This give it a location in the logging hierarchy. Most applications provide a specific set of subsystem names for which logging is meaning; consult the application documentation for the set of names that are actually interesting for the application.
